div.p: RAVA a town oſ Great Poland, and capital of a palatinate of the ſame name, with a fortified caſtle, where they keep ſtate prifoners. The houſes arc built of wood,, and there is a Jeſuits college. It is ſeated in a moraſs covered with water, which proceeds from the ri-ver Rava, with which it is ſurrounded. It is 45 miles f⅝>uth of Bloſko, and 50 fouth-weſt of λVarfaw. The palatinate is bounded on the north by that of Bloſko, on the eaſt by that of Mazovia, on the ſouth by that of Sandomer, and on the weſt by that of Lencieza.
